pullRequest.title: config: fix entering values directly into options with units not working
pullRequest.bodyText:
Currently, trying to enter a value directly into an option with a unit will fail unless the user also inputs the unit.
I was trying to avoid writing a whole AbstractFormatter initially, since it seemed overkill. Evidently, it was the only way to do it properly.
Putting both the Formatter and the Factory in the same file is probably bad. Please let me know how you want it doing
Thanks to Trevor for notifying me of this issue.

beforeCommit.message: config: fix entering values directly into options with units not working

afterCommit.message: config: fix entering values directly into options with units not working

nodes.bodyText: This will throw a StringIndexOutOfBoundsException if you enter a string which is just a number for a field which expects to have units added. Why doesn't this simply check text.endsWith(units)?

nodes.bodyText: Why pass units.value() rather than units itself? I'd rather this factory handle as little as possible and pass most of its logic to the formatter class.
